question: Do MICAL redox enzymes regulate actin organization and dynamics across multiple cell types, including Drosophila muscle and non-neural human cells? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: In this study we show that in non-neural cells human MICALs are required for normal actin organization, and all three MICALs regulate actin stress fibers.
content.source_2: Transgenic interfering RNA experiments in Drosophila muscles indicated that MICAL depletion had no measurable effect on the higher-order arrangement of actin-containing myofilaments, which remained indistinguishable from controls.
content.source_3: In Mical mutant muscle fibers, actin and myosin filaments were incorporated into a normal sarcomeric pattern without submembrane accumulation, indicating that filament organization is unaffected.
